meanings.definition: The state or quality of lacking stiffness or firmness.
meanings.sent1: The limpness of the noodle made it difficult to pick up with chopsticks.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the limpness of the flower petals as they wilted in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The limpness of the balloon made it impossible to tie a knot in it.
meanings.sent4: The limpness of the wet towel reminded her of a defeated soldier's flag.
meanings.sent5: The limpness of the old rubber band made it useless for holding things together.

meanings.definition: A lack of energy or vitality.
meanings.sent1: His face showed the limpness of someone who had been up all night studying.
meanings.sent2: The limpness in her voice indicated she was feeling unwell.
meanings.sent3: The limpness of the party made him wish he had stayed home.
meanings.sent4: The limpness of the battery caused the toy to stop moving.
meanings.sent5: The limpness of the sails signaled the end of the sailing race.
